Call it what it is.  If it's testing transfering
money, call it TransferMoneyFromAccountTest or
something.  Our usual convention, however, is to
simply call it the name of the class we are testing
with Test at the end.  So if you are really testing
the AccountTransfer class then just call it
AccountTransferTest.

-Eric

--- Johannes Link <john.link@...> wrote:
> > Strong suggestion: place these tests in their own
> Test Case class and
> > make the shared data instance variables. It will
> clean things up a lot
> > and shorten the test names.
> 
> Building test classes around the fixture is a good
> idea. However, I'm not
> very comfortable with the names we have chosen for
> these classes so far,
> since it is often difficult to find a descriptive
> way for the fixture
> itself. It's easier when the fixture somehow refers
> to a common
> functionality, eg. AccountTransferTest having two
> Account instances in its
> fixture; but even here the exceptional case of
> transfering money from one
> account to itself only uses one of the two
> instances.
> 
> Any experiences/hints/suggestions with choosing
> names for fixture based test
> classes?
> 
> Johannes
> 
>
